headline.main: Tesla and Google Take Different Roads to Self-Driving Car

docs.abstract: Tesla and Google are among many Silicon Valley companies working on driverless cars and have sharply differing paths; both have had setbacks in process and there is no engineering consensus on best way to approach autonomous driving.

docs.abstract: European Union antitrust regulator Margrethe Vestager announces new set of antitrust charges against Google, saying some of firm's advertising products restricted consumer choice; Google has denied wrongdoing in two previous European antitrust charges.

headline.main: Price-Fixing Truck Makers Get Record E.U. Fine: $3.2 Billion
headline.print_headline: Price-Fixing Truck Makers  Get Record Fine in Europe

docs.abstract: European Union antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager levies record fine of 2.9 billion euros, or $3.2 billion, on group of truck makers for price-fixing and delaying implementation of pollution-controlling pipes and engines.

docs.snippet: The company is financing a series of projects supporting European culture and education as its regulatory woes continue to compound....
docs.lead_paragraph: The company is financing a series of projects supporting European culture and education as its regulatory woes continue to compound.

headline.main: Google, Trying to Endear Itself to Europe, Spreads $450 Million Around

docs.abstract: Google, attempting to endear itself to Europe, is sponsoring digital training in number of schools and supporting museums as it fights growing wave of regulatory hurdles; its soft lobbying efforts are part of push to change its image among Europeans, who largely think of Google as interloper.

docs.snippet: Google recently changed its ad-tracking practices, but you have a say in whether you want to use the new tools....

docs.lead_paragraph: Alphabet’s X research lab is still being asked to imagine the impossible. Only now, under pressure from investors, it has to imagine making money, too.

headline.main: They Promised Us Jet Packs. They Promised the Bosses Profit.

docs.abstract: Alphabet faces criticism over huge sums of money spent by its X lab on highly speculative research projects that never became profit makers; $800 million loss in first quarter for everything outside of Google’s core search and advertising businesses implies firm needs to do more to enforce financial discipline over its broad empire.

docs.snippet: Analysts say the global cloud-computing business will be worth $67 billion by 2020. Amazon and Microsoft are the current leaders in the industry....

headline.main: Google Races to Catch Up in Cloud Computing
headline.print_headline: Google Races to Catch Up in Cloud Computing

docs.abstract: Google has made series of announcement indicating that it is intent on catching up to Amazon and Microsoft in cloud-computing market.

docs.snippet: Verizon is buying an entity that has made repeated missteps, but one that could help it be a stronger contender for digital advertising revenue....
docs.lead_paragraph: Verizon is buying an entity that has made repeated missteps, but one that could help it be a stronger contender for digital advertising revenue.

headline.main: Verizon Announces $4.8 Billion Deal for Yahoo’s Internet Business
headline.print_headline: Verizon to Try Where Marissa Mayer Has Failed: Making Good Use of Yahoo

docs.abstract: Verizon says it will purchase Yahoo's core collection of web properties for $4.83 billion; acquisition of Yahoo's one billion users along with its email and other products is expected to give telecom giant edge it needs to challenge Google and Facebook for consumer attention and digital advertising revenue; sale, which still requires approval by shareholders and regulators, caps four-year failed effort by chief exec Marissa Mayer to stop internet giant's downward spiral.

docs.snippet: Before she led Yahoo, while still at Google, Ms. Mayer spoke of the difficulties for media companies of capitalizing on their own content....
docs.lead_paragraph: Before she led Yahoo, while still at Google, Ms. Mayer spoke of the difficulties for media companies of capitalizing on their own content.

headline.main: Marissa Mayer’s Media Problem at Yahoo Is Now Verizon’s to Solve
headline.print_headline: Mayer’s Media Problem at Yahoo Is Now Verizon’s

docs.abstract: Yahoo's chief executive Marissa Mayer took risky strategy of investing in media properties, publications and video, and now new owner Verizon must figure out way to make company profitable and functional; Verizon does command certain advantages as wireless carrier and phone vendor.

docs.snippet: Dennis Cooper’s vanishing work shows why we shouldn’t trust the cloud....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dennis Cooper’s vanishing work shows why we shouldn’t trust the cloud.

headline.main: The Blog That Disappeared

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Roxane Gay argues abrupt deactivation of writer and artist Dennis Cooper's Google account, and resulting disappearance of 14 years of material, serves as cautionary tale about failure to limit power of corporations and tech entities; holds that whether or not censorship was involved, users risk losing precious material every time they choose to trust cloud.

headline.main: Google Silences Doubters With Blockbuster Quarter
headline.print_headline: Google Silences Doubters With Great Quarter, Lifting Stock 4%

docs.abstract: Google's Alphabet holding company reports second-quarter revenue of $21.5 billion, or $8.42 per share, up 21 percent from year-ago quarter; stock climbs 4 percent on better-than-expected results.
